2892.title: JaredSimpsonsSprites.sea
2892.author: Anonymous
2892.description: If you like the Simpsons you'll like these. They are real cool sprites like Chief Wiggum as the Steel Asteroid and the simpson family as the Asteroids try them Thanks.

2875.title: Animaniacs Sounds.sit
2875.author: Anonymous
2875.description: This is a file to replace the normal sound effects in Maelstrom with sounds from everyone's favorite cartoon, Animaniacs! Narf!

2890.title: Glenns Sprites.sea
2890.author: Anonymous
2890.description: An almost TOTAL make over for Maelstrom 1.4.3, destroy alien eggs and grotesque fetuses in a new ultra modern ship. You're sure to enjoy all the new 3D ray-traced sprites.

2885.title: Coloroids.sea
2885.author: Anonymous
2885.description: This file is an altered version of the original Maelstrom sprites. In this recolored version, you defend a gold ship powered by a blue thruster flame against purple, red, and aqua asteroids. Explosions and other elements have also been recolored.

2908.title: SimpsonsSounds
2908.author: Anonymous
2908.description:
This is a Maelstrom Sounds file I created using ResEdit... It is all sounds from the Fox TV show The Simpsons...  I am pleased with how it turned out...  
Matt Webb
alphasixty@earthlink.net

2909.title: SimsponsSprites
2909.author: Anonymous
2909.description:
This is a Maelstrom Sprites file I created using ResEdit...  These sprites are all from the Fox TV show The Simpsons... This file is best when used with the Simpsons Sounds file I created...  To use these files, just put your original Maelstrom Sounds/Sprites files in a different folder, and replace them with these ones... 
Simspons Sounds (for Maelstrom)
and Simspons Sprites (for Maelstrom) 
were both created by Matt Webb, using Apple's free program called ResEdit, in 1995.
alphasixty@earthlink.net

2882.title: Blazing Saddles Sounds.sit
2882.author: Anonymous
2882.description: Here are some samples from that old knee slapper Blazing Saddles. Does Froggie like daddy? Daddy likes froggie.

2876.title: Army Of Darkness.sit
2876.author: Anonymous
2876.description: These are the infamous Army of Darkness Maelstrom Sounds. If your Mac is equiped a loud sound system and you have an affection for Metallica, these are the sounds for you.

2906.title: Shining Maelstrom.sea
2906.author: Anonymous
2906.description: Here is the weirdly successful marriage of the killer game from Ambrosia Labs, Maelstrom, and the "killer" movie from Stanley Kubrick, "The Shining"! Hear Jack spew loving tidbits like "Shoveling out driveways? Work in a carwash?" while Wendy screams, screams, and screams again.

2910.title: Smiley sprites.sea
2910.author: Anonymous
2910.description: You ever wish the asteroids in Maelstrom were little smiley faces? You too?!? Well, here it is. The sprites file you've been waiting for. Just rename the original sprite file "Original Sprites", and put these sprites in your Maelstrom folder and you are set. No mess, no fee (but please do pay your shareware fee to Ambrosia), no more boring rocks.

2916.title: Trek Sprites.sea
2916.author: Anonymous
2916.description: Finally! Star Trek Sprites for Maelstrom. Ever wanted to do dough-nuts in the Enterprise? Ever wanted to blow away a Borg ship? Take the conn, ensign...

2880.title: Beavis Butthead Sounds.sea
2880.author: Anonymous
2880.description: It had to happen. It just had to. Yes! the Beavis and Butthead sound collection for Maelstrom. Hear your favorite "Huh - uhh - uhuh" in ways you never imagined.

2900.title: Monty Maelstrom.sea
2900.author: Anonymous
2900.description: Are you a Knight that says "Nee?" You will be. Does your brain hurt? It will. This sound file takes "I move for no man" to a new level.

2877.title: BabylonMaelstromsounds.sea
2877.author: Anonymous
2877.description: [b]SOUND FILE[/b]This is a replacement sound file, containing sound clips from the Babylon 5 science fiction series, now being shown on TNT.  Sorry, I used up all my creativity in making the sound file. grin

2901.title: Moosestrom.sea
2901.author: Anonymous
2901.description: Well, I think it qualifies as an odd thing. Full of strange, original, fantastic animation. Also available at http://homepages.gs.net/~twomoose/ernge.html

2915.title: Trek Sounds.sea
2915.author: Anonymous
2915.description: Finally! Star Trek Sounds for Maelstrom. This collection of sounds is only for those at the final frontier of Maelstrom playing. You'll need to allocate extra memory though.

2881.title: Belch.sea
2881.author: Anonymous
2881.description: Every sound has been replaced with a belch except one, and that one has been replaced with an angry dog sound. Don't ask, I don't know, it's very wacky.

2891.title: Heavymetalstrom.sea
2891.author: Anonymous
2891.description: Welcome to Heavy Metalstrom, that strange corner of the galaxy where old guitars and drums float aimlessly, accompanied by the loudest sounds you will ever hear!

2912.title: Star Wars Sprites.sea
2912.author: Anonymous
2912.description: "Finally, Star Wars Sprites for Maelstrom! Use the Millennium Falcon to Destroy asteroids, X-Wings, Imperial Shuttles, and the Death Star with a little help from Yoda and the droids, and a special appearance by Boba Fett."

2873.title: Akira Maelstrom.sit
2873.author: Anonymous
2873.description: These sounds require more memory to be alocated for Maelstrom. They are taken from a series in Japan called Akira. Many of then are fun and add an interesting dimension to the game.

2874.title: Ambitious Sounds.sea
2874.author: Anonymous
2874.description: These sounds were taken from several versions of "Ambitious" by Wire. They were sampled at 11.127kHz, 8 bits, mono. The idea is that, as the game is played, a dynamic mix of the song is created. Cool, huh?

2878.title: Baseball Sprites.sea
2878.author: Anonymous
2878.description: Are you a big fan of baseball? Getting a little tired of shooting rocks? Here are a set of sprites that are made in America.

2879.title: Battlestar.sea
2879.author: Anonymous
2879.description: Remember that really cool sci-fi show on TV back in the late '70s called "Battlestar Galactica"? Well I do, and this is a patch for Maelstrom that changes the sounds and some of the screens into Battlestar Galactica sounds and screens.

2883.title: Christmas Sprites.sit
2883.author: Anonymous
2883.description: For the holiday season, here are some sprites for Maelstrom that will give you something to shoot for (or shoot at, anyway). Santa, presents, even tree ornaments are here for your holiday destruction.

2884.title: Claivcle Super Sounds.sit
2884.author: Anonymous
2884.description: Jimi Hendrix, Stone Temple Pilots, Nine Inch Nails and U2 sounds sampled by clavicle. All the other sounds scraped off of other files.

2886.title: Disk Sprites.sea
2886.author: Anonymous
2886.description: This is an unusual set of sprites that takes a little getting used to. But they are very well done and fit the computer motif quite well. Download these and shoot your floppies.

2887.title: Dr Who Maelstrom Snds.sea
2887.author: Anonymous
2887.description: This file contains sounds from the British Sci-Fi TV show, Doctor Who. I saw Star Wars and Star Trek here so I thought, "Why not Doctor Who?". Well here it is.

2888.title: eighties.Maelstrom.sea
2888.author: Anonymous
2888.description: Go get some change and enjoy the "original" version of Maelstrom! This replaces both the Maelstom Sprites and Sounds.

2889.title: Funky Maelstrom Sounds.sit
2889.author: Anonymous
2889.description: When you hear the word Funky, images of George Clinton and the Red Hot Chili Peppers come to mind. But not here, these sounds give the word "funky" a new meaning.

2917.title: Zima Sprites.sit
2917.author: Anonymous
2917.description: This is probably the most interesting use of resources to ever grace a Mac. Either the creator really likes Zima, or really hates it. Either way, this sprites file is definately zomething different.

2893.title: Maelstrom Cursors.sit
2893.author: Anonymous
2893.description: Author's description: Attention all you Maelstrom fans! Here it is - the Maelstrom startup screen! If you're like me and can't get enough of Ambrosia's great game - Maelstrom, then this is the startup screen for you.

2894.title: Maelstrom Icons.sit
2894.author: Anonymous
2894.description: Author's description: This is a set of SimpleText documents. The documents themselves are nothing special, but their icons are. Each of the three SimpleText files contains a super-spiffy icon made from the shareware game Maelstrom. Use get info, copy, and paste to use these icons on your very own files, folders, and disks.

2895.title: Maelstrom ppats.sit
2895.author: Anonymous
2895.description: Author's description: A couple of patterns I "made" based on one of the most popular shareware game of all time, Maelstrom. The patterns are 128x128, so you'll have to use Before Dark, Chameleon, or something else to view them (ResEdit won't work).

2896.title: Maelstrom Startup.sit
2896.author: Anonymous
2896.description: Author's description: Attention all you Maelstrom fans! Here it is - the Maelstrom startup screen! If you're like me and can't get enough of Ambrosia's great game - Maelstrom, then this is the startup screen for you.

2897.title: Maestrom Classic Sounds.sea
2897.author: Anonymous
2897.description: These classic sounds are taken from a variety of places. From classic rock to classic sitcoms, just about every fetish is satisfied with this set of sounds. These sounds also require more memory for Maelstrom.

2898.title: Mixed Maelstrom Sounds.sit
2898.author: Anonymous
2898.description: The sounds file is a mixed bag of two or three of the sound files available here. It makes for an interesting mix.

2899.title: Modified Maelstrom Sprites
2899.author: Anonymous
2899.description: Psychedilia infiltrates your Mac. Maelstrom has an unusual look. Wow ... What's going on, everything looks so different. Oh ... nothing to worry about, your Maelstrom sprites have been modified.

2902.title: More Maelstrom Icons.sit
2902.author: Anonymous
2902.description: Author's description: I, Chris Kerr, used ResEdit and my friend's version of Maelstrom to make these these cool icons. For a complete set of icons, including ones from other games, e-mail me and I will tell you how you can get them.

2903.title: MST3K.sea
2903.author: Anonymous
2903.description: Have you ever wanted to play Maelstrom and watch Mystery Science Theater 3000 at the same time? Well, Now you can, sort of! Try it, it's fun. Some of these sounds are kinda big, so you'll need to increase the memory settings.

2904.title: Musical Maelstrom.sea
2904.author: Anonymous
2904.description: Do you have a taste for music? This sounds file takes musical masterpieces and combines them with mass destruction for a combination to satisfy all tastes. Raising Maelstrom's memory allocation is recommended when using these sounds.

2905.title: Price.Right.Maelstrom.sea
2905.author: Anonymous
2905.description: Get ready to Come On Down! for fantastic prizes and exciting merchandise! It's the fabulous 60 Minute Price Is Right Maelstrom!!!

2907.title: Simpsons Maelstrom.sea
2907.author: Anonymous
2907.description: Our favorite degenerate family from Springfield brings us one of the most unusual sets of sounds to date. Would you expect less?

2911.title: Star Wars Sounds.sit
2911.author: Anonymous
2911.description: Ah, Maelstrom vs. The Force. What better combination of good against evil can you get.

2913.title: Stooge Sounds.sea
2913.author: Anonymous
2913.description: Author's Notes: I created these sounds for Maelstrom because I saw something lacking in the list of available slternative sounds for the game. With "The Simpsons" and "Blazing Saddles" sounds out there, how could someone overlook the Stooges?

2914.title: Tori Sounds.sea
2914.author: Anonymous
2914.description: This file contains sound bites of Tori Amos replacing the standard sounds with cooler Tori ones.
